page.title: 06NOTEABLE BUILDINGS-HORBURY
page.content: The most noteable buildings ofthe area include St Peters and St Leonards Church in Horbury.John Carr,its architecht replaced the original Norman Church with an Italian Gothic styled building which dominates the landscape. The house in Carr Lodge Park is a remarkable example of eighteenth century Georgian architecture. The symmetrical building set in park land earned it the title of Horbury's "finest house" in the grim developments of the nineteenth century. St Peter's Convent,which houses a private school,is one of Horbury's outstanding Victorian buildings.Its green spire can be seen on the hillside,along with St Peters Church,for miles around.
